entry.title: setTimeout with delay 0 works unexpectedly
entry.content:
# Steps to reproduce the problem run code ```js setTimeout(() => console.log(1), 1) for(let i=0;i<1e9;i++){} // way more cost than 1ms setTimeout(() => console.log(2), 0) ``` ```js setTimeout(() => console.log(1), 2) for(let i=0;i<1e9;i++){} // way more cost than 1ms setTimeout(() => console.log(2), 1) ```
# Problem Description - the first case logs `2 1` while the second case logs `1 2`. - In Theory, It all should log `1 2` and Firefox and Safari did so
# Summary setTimeout with delay 0 works unexpectedly
# Additional Data Category: JavaScript \ Chrome Channel: Stable \ Regression: N/A

entry.title: "Downloading speech files" doesn't respect the user's metered network setting.
entry.content:
Version 124. "Downloading speech files" doesn't respect the user's metered network setting.
Whereas the weekly system update asks if it should download over the user's metered wifi, "Downloading speech files" just goes ahead.

entry.title: Chromium Build bug
entry.content:
# Steps to reproduce the problem 1. autoninja -C out/debug chrome
# Problem Description In the file "mojo/public/tools/bindings/generators/mojom_js_generator.py", the `_GetWebUiModulePath` function should always return 'Chrome://resources/' or '/'. However, `tab_group_types` returns `//tab_group_types.mojom-webui.js`, which the `_GetJsModuleImports` function recognizes as a network path in `os.path.relpath`, resulting in an error.
``` [Debug] ***************************************** //tab_group_types.mojom-webui.js / [Debug] ***************************************** Traceback (most recent call last): File "C:\Users\rotiple\Downloads\chrome\src\mojo\public\tools\bindings\mojom_bindings_generator.py", line 417, in <module> ret = main() ^^^^^^ File "C:\Users\rotiple\Downloads\chrome\src\mojo\public\tools\bindings\mojom_bindings_generator.py", line 412, in main return args.func(args, remaining_args) ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^ File "C:\Users\rotiple\Downloads\chrome\src\mojo\public\tools\bindings\mojom_bindings_generator.py", line 274, in _Generate processor._GenerateModule( File "C:\Users\rotiple\Downloads\chrome\src\mojo\public\tools\bindings\mojom_bindings_generator.py", line 242, in _GenerateModule generator.GenerateFiles(filtered_args) File "C:\Users\rotiple\Downloads\chrome\src\mojo\public\tools\bindings\generators\mojom_js_generator.py", line 433, in GenerateFiles ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^ File "C:\Users\rotiple\Downloads\chrome\src\mojo\public\tools\mojom\mojom\generate\template_expander.py", line 34, in GeneratorInternal parameters = generator(*args, **kwargs2) ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^ File "C:\Users\rotiple\Downloads\chrome\src\mojo\public\tools\bindings\generators\mojom_js_generator.py", line 412, in _GenerateWebUiModule return self._GetParameters(for_webui_module=True) ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^ File "C:\Users\rotiple\Downloads\chrome\src\mojo\public\tools\bindings\generators\mojom_js_generator.py", line 299, in _GetParameters self._GetJsModuleImports(for_webui_module=for_webui_module), ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^ File "C:\Users\rotiple\Downloads\chrome\src\mojo\public\tools\bindings\generators\mojom_js_generator.py", line 1046, in _GetJsModuleImports os.path.relpath( File "<frozen ntpath>", line 766, in relpath ValueError: path is on mount '\\\\tab_group_types.mojom-webui.js', start on mount 'C:' ```
# Summary Chromium Build bug
# Additional Data Category: Installation \ Chrome Channel: Stable \ Regression: N/A

entry.title: unable to render WebGPU using Chrome nightly running on Ubuntu 22.04 + NVidia RTX4090
entry.content:
## CHROME UNSTABLE WITH RECOMMENDED FLAGS CANNOT RENDER [hello triangle WebGPU sample](https://webgpu.github.io/webgpu-samples/?sample=helloTriangle) ```bash # doesnt work google-chrome-unstable --enable-unsafe-webgpu --enable-features=Vulkan,UseSkiaRenderer
# -> Warning: loader_parse_icd_manifest: Can not find 'ICD' object in ICD JSON file /usr/share/vulkan/icd.d/nvidia_layers.json. Skipping ICD JSON Warning: terminator_CreateInstance: Received return code -3 from call to vkCreateInstance in ICD /usr/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libvulkan_virtio.so. Skipping this driver. [699872:699872:0419/082749.181393:ERROR:shared_image_representation.cc(816)] Error creating wgpu::Texture [699872:699872:0419/082749.181946:ERROR:shared_image_representation.cc(483)] Attempt to read from an uninitialized SharedImage. Initialized region: (0, 0, 0, 0) Size: (600, 600)
``` fallback to CPU works very slow: ```bash google-chrome-unstable --enable-unsafe-webgpu --use-angle=swiftshader --enable-features=ReduceOpsTaskSplitting,Vulkan,VulkanFromANGLE,DefaultANGLEVulkan ```
## Spec: - OS: Ubuntu 22.04.4 LTS x86_64 - Host: ROG Strix G834JY_G834JY 1.0 - Kernel: 6.5.0-27-generic - DE: GNOME 42.9 - WM: Mutter - CPU: 13th Gen Intel i9-13980HX (32) @ 5.400GHz - GPU: Intel Raptor Lake-S UHD Graphics - GPU: NVIDIA RTX4090 GN21-X11 - libvulkan1 1.3.204.1-2 - `echo $XDG_SESSION_TYPE` -> x11 - `nvidia-smi` -> Driver Version: 545.23.08 CUDA Version: 12.3 - Google Chrome 125.0.6420.3 dev
## ICD config: - `cat /usr/share/vulkan/icd.d/nvidia_layers.json` ```json { "file_format_version" : "1.0.0", "layer": { "name": "VK_LAYER_NV_optimus", "type": "INSTANCE", "library_path": "libGLX_nvidia.so.0", "api_version" : "1.3.260", "implementation_version" : "1", "description" : "NVIDIA Optimus layer", "functions": { "vkGetInstanceProcAddr": "vk_optimusGetInstanceProcAddr", "vkGetDeviceProcAddr": "vk_optimusGetDeviceProcAddr" }, "enable_environment": { "__NV_PRIME_RENDER_OFFLOAD": "1" }, "disable_environment": { "DISABLE_LAYER_NV_OPTIMUS_1": "" } }, "ICD": { "library_path": "libGLX_nvidia.so.0", "api_version" : "1.3.260" }
} ``` ## diagnostic: chrome://gpu/ (file attached)
Graphics Feature Status ======================= * Canvas: Hardware accelerated * Canvas out-of-process rasterization: Enabled * Direct Rendering Display Compositor: Disabled * Compositing: Hardware accelerated * Multiple Raster Threads: Enabled * OpenGL: Enabled * Rasterization: Hardware accelerated * Raw Draw: Disabled * Skia Graphite: **Disabled** * Video Decode: Hardware accelerated * Video Encode: Software only. Hardware acceleration disabled * Vulkan: Enabled * WebGL: Hardware accelerated * WebGL2: Hardware accelerated * WebGPU: Hardware accelerated * WebNN: **Disabled** * ## diagnostic: https://webgpureport.org/ (file attached)
## vulkan diagnostics - (file attached) - seems capable to render vkcube outside of chrome ```bash vulkaninfo | grep warning  ✔ │ at 08:59:57  WARNING: [Loader Message] Code 0 : terminator_CreateInstance: Failed to CreateInstance in ICD 4. Skipping ICD. ``` ```bash ./vkvia
VIA_INFO: SDK Found! - Will attempt to run tests VIA_INFO: Attempting to run vkcube in VIA_INFO: Command-line: vkcube --c 100 --suppress_popups /usr/bin/vkcube Selected GPU 1: NVIDIA GeForce RTX 4090 Laptop GPU, type: DiscreteGpu VIA_INFO: Command-line: vkcube --c 100 --suppress_popups --validate /usr/bin/vkcube WARNING : GENERAL - Message Id Number: 0 | Message Id Name: Loader Message terminator_CreateInstance: Received return code -3 from call to vkCreateInstance in ICD /usr/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libvulkan_virtio.so. Skipping this driver.
Objects - 1 Object[0] - VK_OBJECT_TYPE_INSTANCE, Handle 0x578c2b2b7980
Selected GPU 1: NVIDIA GeForce RTX 4090 Laptop GPU, type: DiscreteGpu SUCCESS: Vulkan analysis completed properly using Vulkan 1.3 ```

entry.title: Bubble in Google Meet is clipped
entry.content:
Version: 126.0.6426.0 for both Lacros and Ash
The view (probably bubble?) to share the screen on Google Meet is clipped by the window boundary even after crbug.com/40058249.

entry.content:

entry.title: Remove dtf chromium console
entry.content:
This [console](https://ci.chromium.org/p/devtools-frontend/g/chromium/console) tracks Chromium changes to anticipate if Chromium is going to break DevTools Frontend. The builder in this console also closes the tree.
This is confusing for the devs as the tree closure should be actionable. After removing the builder from the tree closers config the signal it was supposed to send will most likely just be ignored.
We will just remove the builder and the console together with it.

entry.title: After applying theme from chrome web store,observe "share doddle" option in red color,icon is not visible
entry.content:
Chrome Version: Ash-chrome M125 Dev 125.0.6422.5/15853.4.0 on Tomato(cherry) device - Arm64/lacros64 Lacros Version: Lacros Dev RC #126.0.6423.2 lacros only] OS: chrome
Pre-condition: Apply theme from chrome web store
Details: 1)Accounts: Corp account and Test account 2)Enterprise Enrolled: Yes, enrolled with Corp account 3)Devices: Non-Corp device Strongbad(Homestar) - Arm64/lacros64 Hana(Hana) - arm64/lacros32
4)Repro on Ash-chrome: yes
5)Mode: NA
6)Frequency: Always
Enabled the lacros flags #lacros-stability = Dev #lacros-only = Enabled #enable-component-updater-test-request = Enabled #lacros-availability-ignore = Enabled
What steps will reproduce the problem? (1) Launch Lacros (2)From chrome web store,try to apply any theme ex: "https://chromewebstore.google.com/detail/minecraft-dungeons/icbjaidedoblbjffbcmkejcjhkcoaloj" (3) Open NTP,try to observe "share doddle" option
What is the expected result? When applied theme from chrome web store,"share doddle" icon should be visible
What happens instead? When applied theme from chrome web store,"share doddle" icon is not visible,it is in red in color
Note: 1)Issue observed in both ash-chrome and lacros
Issue seems to be Regression, issue worked fine on Ash-beta M124 Beta #124.0.6367.34/15823.23.0 on Collis(Volteer) device - X86_lacros 64
Attached screencast for the reference
Attached listnr feedback report

entry.title: Window jitters when tab preview bubble shows on upper side
entry.content:
Version: 126.0.6426.0 for both Lacros and Ash
When showing the tab preview bubble, its parent window's boundary jitters from time to time especially when changing the size of the bubble.
The video only contains the scenario when the bubble goes up and down, but we can observe the jittering even when the bubble is both up-up.

entry.title: Chrome show empty error message when websocket connection failed
entry.content:
# Steps to reproduce the problem My websocket backend is Spring Boot(Tomcat) when the origin not allowed, the websocket backend return 403 response for the upgrade request. while in chrome console, it shows: ``` SEAExportDialog.vue:104 WebSocket connection to 'wss://portal-local.itps.xxx.com:3000/ws/export/sea/users' failed: ``` there is no description after the `failed:`
and from the network tab I can't find any useful information to addressing the real problem either.
# Problem Description Why is this behaviour happen ? any reason for this ?
# Summary Chrome show empty error message when websocket connection failed
# Additional Data Category: Network / Downloading \ Chrome Channel: Stable \ Regression: N/A
